comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From the Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:BRYSON, JOHN BERESFORD
Initials:J B
Nationality:Australian
Rank:Corporal
Regiment/Service:Australian Infantry, A.I.F.
Unit Text:53rd Bn.
Age:25
Date of Death:19/07/1916
Service No:3494
Additional information:Son of James and Emily Bryson, of Huskisson, New South Wales.
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Grave/Memorial Reference:I. F. 28.
Cemetery:RUE-DU-BOIS MILITARY CEMETERY, FLEURBAIX

comment.author: 69717788@N04
comment._content: www.aif.adfa.edu.au:8080/showPerson?pid=37424 Regimental number 3494 School Public School, Cleveland Street, Redfern, New South Wales Religion Church of England Occupation Mechanical dentistry Address Huskisson, via Nowra, New South Wales Marital status Single Age at embarkation 24 Next of kin Mother, Mrs E Dent, 115 Young Street, Annandale, New South Wales Previous military service Nil Enlistment date 1 August 1915 Rank on enlistment Private Unit name 2nd Battalion, 11th Reinforcement AWM Embarkation Roll number 23/19/2 Embarkation details Unit embarked from Sydney, New South Wales, on board HMAT A14 Euripides on 2 November 1915 Rank from Nominal Roll Corporal Unit from Nominal Roll 53rd Battalion Fate Killed in Action 19 July 1916 Place of death or wounding Fleurbaix, France Age at death 25.8 Age at death from cemetery records 25 Place of burial Rue-Du-Bois Military Cemetery (Plot I, Row F, Grave No. 28), Fleurbaix, France Panel number, Roll of Honour, Australian War Memorial Text printed in Sydney Morning Herald on 2nd Sept 1916: Cpl John Beresford Bryson (Jark), eldest son of Mrs. R. Dent, 45 Mort street, Balmain. Some time we'll understand Inserted by his sorrowing parents, Mr and Mrs Dent, sister, and brother- in- law, Mrs and Mr. J Patterson, Dilga and brother, Jim. trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15675915

comment._content: you can see his service record here: mappingouranzacs.naa.gov.au/list-name.aspx?name=bryson
